title: GeoGebra-Based Mathematics Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program: Social Interaction and Technology Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic secondary mathematics concepts, mobile device usage experience, social interaction experience in educational settings
context.additional_context: A customized course for in-service secondary math teachers to develop technology integration skills, focusing on GeoGebra utilization in smartphone environments and enhancing autonomous lesson design capabilities. Emphasizes building collaborative relationships with peer teachers and fostering social learning environments within educational communities.

learning_goals: Learners create geometry concept visualization materials using GeoGebraâ€™s basic functions and foster a collaborative problem-solving environment among learners.

During a 4-week mid-term course, learners autonomously design pedagogical decisions for three math lessons in mobile environments (e.g., Google Classroom, Zoom Breakout Rooms), achieve an average of 4 out of 5 on a peer/lecturer feedback rubric, and strengthen social relationship-building and communication skills.
Learners improve technology-integrated lesson models through peer feedback and reflective practice, fostering a collaborative learning culture within the educational community.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
